intro: Hedysarum brasilianum, commonly known as Brazilian sweet clover, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant is typically found in grasslands and open areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It has a climbing habit and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Hedysarum brasilianum is also valued for its role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility.
